spec-features-maintainer.description: 33 core features identified including project initialization, live sync server, building, uploading, and file format support

spec-schema-maintainer.notes: Not applicable - Rojo is a CLI tool without persistent database. Uses in-memory VFS and instance snapshots.

spec-api-maintainer.description: HTTP API endpoints for server info, instance reading, WebSocket upgrade, and snapshot operations

spec-design-maintainer.notes: Web UI uses server-side rendering with Ritz JSX-like templating. No design system framework detected.

spec-env-maintainer.description: Environment variables including RUST_LOG, RUST_BACKTRACE, and various Rojo-specific config options

spec-critical-paths-maintainer.description: Critical user flows: Project Init, Live Sync, Building, Uploading, and Syncback (two-way sync)

spec-tech-stack-maintainer.description: Comprehensive Rust tech stack including Tokio, Hyper, rbx-dom, Serde, and 50+ dependencies

quality-lessons-maintainer.description: Patterns and architectural insights around VFS design, snapshot system, async patterns, and testing

quality-issues-maintainer.description: Quality issues including TODOs, potential optimizations, and documentation gaps

recommendations.description: Address performance optimization for RojoRef internment strategy (src/rojo_ref.rs:8)
Improve project.rs documentation for properties field constraints (src/project.rs:381)
Improve root directory detection in syncback (src/syncback/mod.rs:62)
Add E2E tests for critical user paths (project init → live sync → build)
Document WebSocket protocol version handling and migration strategy

project_characteristics.architecture: Multi-threaded async server with in-memory VFS
